Title: Initialization Not Disabled for Implementation Contracts
Content:
Throughout the codebase, implementation contracts are used behind proxies for upgradeability. Hence, many contracts have an `initialize` function that sets up the proxy. It is a good practice to not leave implementation contracts uninitialized, hence, consider calling [`_disableInitializers`](https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts-upgradeable/blob/release-v4.9/contracts/proxy/utils/Initializable.sol#L145) of the inherited `Initializable` contract from the `constructor` to prevent initialization of the implementation contract.


***Update:** Resolved in [pull request #639](https://github.com/scroll-tech/scroll/pull/639/files) at commit [d1b7719](https://github.com/scroll-tech/scroll/pull/639/commits/d1b77199a9306a051569c69ff8f55a4f48cc2f1e). It is worth noting that the [`SimpleGasOracle` contract](https://github.com/scroll-tech/scroll/blob/d1b77199a9306a051569c69ff8f55a4f48cc2f1e/contracts/src/libraries/oracle/SimpleGasOracle.sol#L44-L51) has not been fixed. The Scroll team stated:*



> *The `SimpleGasOracle` contract is not being used anymore, we are considerting its removal at a later time.*
